caption: Amazing... This is pratically the foundation of the city of Paris. A lot of people chilling out in the tribune while some young fellows play calmly soccer   and jn another part of the arena a group play "boules".
We passed there amd enjoyed watching people playing different old game

Nice semi-hidden gem in Paris. It's a great place to hang out a little bit or rest your legs if you don't necessarily want to enter a bar. It's not reeeeaaaaly exploited as a tourist attraction, so, expect a tiny bit of gravel, did and weeds on the seats. So, maybe a place to avoid if you're uptight. Otherwise a must-see if your nearby. (Edit: typo 'hidden')
Cool place for having great time
Charming oasis. Work outside. Just relax. Enjoy the fragrance of the plants and bird songs. Admire historic heritage
Nice place to have lunch, play p√©tanque or just hang around some
Nice place to have a sandwich
Historical place but nothing much to see its just a public spot
Nice place to relax and read a book.
Very nice place to chill
Cool hidden piece of history!
A park with Historical arena
Beautiful

Pretty Parisian park nestled between apartment buildings, the entrance to the park is unique, it doesn't seem like there is a huge park in the form of an arena. It has a children's play area, benches and a picnic area,
I found it tidy and clean. In the arena there are bowls freely available (via app) to entertain yourself. Playground and bathrooms with soap.

I love this somewhat secret place in Paris, a stone's throw from the boulevards, the arena is a playground for bowlers and football fans. And for the others we stroll in the sun and chat on the high benches. Quiet and surprising place, especially when it's the first time you discover it. Still great.

I like this park built around the Arena. There are plenty of sheltered places where you can isolate yourself. In particular, there are a few benches on a hillock with a small access path into the greenery.

A magnificent timeless place, you can come across groups of young people playing Ultimate as well as families with young children. There's plenty of room and it's not too busy. The place is just beautiful with different spaces.

One of only two remaining Roman buildings in Paris. It‚Äôs not anything particularly outstanding, it‚Äôs not a Colosseum, but it looks cool among modern architecture. Entry, oddly enough, is free. For show, I advise you to stop by.

Ancient site of the Gallo-Roman arenas. In good weather we meet the neighborhood bowlers there. Don't hesitate to enjoy everything by sitting in the stands. Ideally located between Jussieu and the Jardin des Plantes.
The Ar√®nes de Lut√®ce is a bridge between history and current Parisian life, a perfect place to soak up culture while enjoying a moment of tranquility
Beautiful, vast and quiet square. I recommend to recharge your batteries in Paris.

Park which surrounds the Ar√®nes de Lut√®ce and its stands, accessible by circular slopes or by the stairs of the stands, very tree-filled and spacious despite its small size. You can contemplate the Arena from this park, and it greens this vestige of Parisian antiquity üíöüíöüíö ‚Ä¶
Roman arena with stands in the center of Paris, a stone's throw from Jussieu station. You absolutely have to visit, there is a garden.. üëç ‚Ä¶
An oasis of greenery and ancient architecture in Paris, calm unless the boules or ball players invade the scene...
Very well attended.  We plunged back into the past. A serene atmosphere.

As a regular visitor, I never let myself sit in the stands around the arena and observe the life around me, the ideal place for children who have fun and adults who like to find happiness in the little things
A place that is not only historic but also very chill and sedate

Very nice park but quickly full in case of crowds because it is rather small. Lots of groups playing molky or boules, which creates a pretty funny picture with the arenas and Parisian buildings as a backdrop.

Place where our history and young people who play ball mix. Quiet place to read, meditate or stroll in the garden area. The garden reveals beautiful specimens including a twisted beech. It's a peaceful place that would almost make us forget that we are in Paris.
Very beautiful park, original, a little hidden so not too busy....a really special atmosphere of its own. We like to come across them when we pass through the neighborhood.
Ideal for children, to climb or hide. For parents, bowling in the arenas.

Fairly lively square, rather pleasant atmosphere among the old stones of the arenas, unfortunately not 360¬∞. Some corners not very clean. Not ideal for young children (height of steps and gravel dust)
Very pleasant place with a good quality children's play area! It‚Äôs a great place to take a short walk!

A peaceful setting in the middle of an urban area. It's like a small village square, where people play and relax. The association between the history of the place and the vegetation is very beautiful!
A haven of peace and greenery in the heart of Paris. A very pleasant place to have a picnic, take a break, read a book in peace. No music, no wifi, no commotion, no noise.
Too many people on this sunny day!
It's just not bad
